intro: Quadrella angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf quadrella, is a herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The plant features slender, elongated leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences, and are usually greenish or white in color. Quadrella angustifolia plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small vertebrates.
